title: Bangladesh air force jet crashes into school: At least 19 dead, over 100 injured
content: A Bangladesh air force training aircraft, identified as an F-7 BGI, crashed into Milestone School and College in Dhaka's Uttara area during a routine training mission. The crash, which occurred around 1:06 pm while classes were in session, resulted in at least one fatality and several injuries.

title: 'Not immediately worried': Himanta plays down fears over China's Brahmaputra dam
content: Assam's chief minister, Himanta Biswa Sarma, addressed concerns regarding China's Brahmaputra dam project, stating there's no immediate cause for alarm as the river's flow relies on multiple sources, including Bhutan, Arunachal Pradesh, and local rainfall. He acknowledged conflicting views on the dam's impact and expressed confidence in the Union government's handling of discussions with China on this significant infrastructure endeavor.

title: Indore-bound IndiGo flight reports technical snag, lands safely
content: An IndiGo flight 6E 813, en route from Goa to Indore, experienced a technical issue just before landing on Monday. According to an IndiGo spokesperson, the aircraft landed safely in Indore and will undergo thorough checks as per protocol before resuming operations.

title: 17 kgs down! Prithvi Shaw dragged into Sarfaraz Khan's transformation
content: Sarfaraz Khan, despite his strong domestic performances, has faced questions about his fitness while vying for a permanent spot on the Indian national team. He has now responded by shedding an impressive 17 kilograms. His dedication drew praise, including from Kevin Pietersen, who lauded Sarfaraz's efforts and encouraged Prithvi Shaw to follow suit.

title: China‚Äôs ‚ÄòLeave India‚Äô order to engineers: Trade body‚Äôs SOS to government
content: India's electronics industry is sounding alarms over China's alleged informal trade restrictions, fearing a crippling blow to its global competitiveness and a $32 billion smartphone export target. The ICEA, representing major manufacturers, claims China's actions deliberately undermine India's manufacturing rise, causing delays and increased costs.

title: 'Jadeja fought very hard but ... ': Siraj breaks silence on gut-wrenching Lord's defeat
content: Mohammed Siraj expresses his disappointment over India's narrow loss at Lord's. He recalls his dismissal and the emotions running high during the match. Siraj mentions his verbal exchange with Joe Root. He says he was trying to distract the batter. Siraj confirms he will maintain his aggressive approach in the crucial fourth Test at Old Trafford.

title: 'Deadman walking': How Epstein became a monster for Trump - and a MAGA problem
content: Trump promised fireworks. What they got instead was a soggy sparkler titled ‚ÄúEpstein Files: Phase One.‚Äù No client list. No smoking gun. No Clintons in handcuffs. Just an Attorney General, Pam Bondi, who teased the public with binders full of nothing and then said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs on my desk.‚Äù The same desk, presumably, where populist credibility goes to die.

title: Aadhaar updates: How UIDAI aims to curb frauds through Aadhaar, fake UID numbers
content: UIDAI is bolstering Aadhaar's security to combat fraud, CEO Bhuvnesh Kumar announced. Measures include restricting frequent birthdate and biometric modifications, cross-referencing data with official databases, and employing AI/ML to detect inaccuracies.

title: Perplexity CEO to youngsters: Spend less time on Instagram, more time on‚Ä¶
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas advises young individuals to prioritize mastering AI tools over excessive social media use, emphasizing that AI proficiency will significantly enhance employability. He acknowledges the challenges of adapting to rapidly evolving AI technology, which changes every three to six months.

title: Illegal betting app row: ED summons top Telugu stars
content: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned film stars Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, Vijay Deverakonda, and Manchu Lakshmi, amidst an ongoing investigation into the promotion of illegal online betting apps. These summons follow the registration of a case under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act against 29 actors and influencers.

title: Tamil Nadu: Three workers die in fireworks unit blast near Sivakasi
content: An explosion at Mariammal Fireworks in Andiyapuram village, near Sivakasi, resulted in the deaths of three workers on Monday afternoon. The blast, triggered by chemical friction in a working shed, also left three others injured, who are currently receiving treatment at Sivakasi Government Hospital.

title: 'Jassi bhai khelenge': Siraj clears the air, gives major update on Akash Deep
content: Ahead of the crucial fourth Test against England, Mohammed Siraj confirmed Jasprit Bumrah's participation while Akash Deep's fitness remains under assessment due to a groin issue. Siraj, a standout performer with 13 wickets in 3 matches, expressed his desire to seize opportunities and play for the country.

title: US Green Card delay: Public transit authority CEO resigns as work permit expires
content: The U.S. Green Card delays are impacting American corporations, forcing experienced executives to resign due to expiring work permits. Collie Greenwood, CEO of MARTA, stepped down after his permit expired, hindering key projects. Despite MARTA's confirmation of his 'imminent' Green Card delivery, Greenwood opted for early retirement.

title: For students' safety: CBSE orders schools to install CCTVs in classes, playgrounds
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has introduced updated safety guidelines requiring all affiliated schools to install high-resolution CCTV cameras with audiovisual recording. Coverage must include classrooms and all common areas, excluding toilets and washrooms. Footage must be stored for at least 15 days and made available to authorities when needed. The directive aligns with NCPCR's safety manual and aims to ensure a secure and supportive environment for all students and staff within school premises.

title: Air India plane veers off runway: What caused the skid, how it unfolded
content: An Air India flight, AI 2744, arriving from Kochi, skidded off Mumbai airport's main runway amidst heavy monsoon rains on Monday. The Airbus A320 lost control during deceleration after touchdown, veering onto a taxiway. While all passengers and crew are safe, three tyres burst during the incident. Runway 27 was temporarily closed, and the secondary runway was activated.

title: LNMU Part 3 Result 2022-25 declared: Bihar University publishes marks; check direct link, steps to download
content: Lalit Narayan Mithila University (LNMU) has released the Part 3 result for the 2022-25 academic session on its official website lnmu.ac.in. The examinations were conducted across Bihar from March 20 to April 16, 2025. Students can now check their results online by entering their roll numbers. The university had issued the admit cards on March 18, 2025, and declared the results on July 21, 2025, completing the semester exam process smoothly.

title: Watch: Shreyas Iyer goes full Usain Bolt mode; video goes viral
content: Shreyas Iyer, despite final defeats as captain of Punjab Kings in IPL 2025 and SoBo Mumbai Falcons in the Mumbai T20 League, remains focused on fitness. A video of Iyer sprinting energetically on the track has gone viral, showcasing his dedication. He was spotted in Kazakhstan a month ago during his break.

title: AI171 crash: Centre issued 9 safety notices to Air India in 6 months
content: Air India faces scrutiny following a tragic crash of Flight AI171, a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad, resulting in 260 fatalities. Minister Murlidhar Mohol reported nine show cause notices issued to Air India for safety violations. A formal investigation is under way, with a preliminary report citing engine failure and cockpit confusion.

title: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Paresh Rawal clapped back at trolls after revealing his unconventional health remedy. An old photo of Ajay Devgn with Shahid Afridi resurfaced, causing unnecessary controversy. Nawazuddin Siddiqui opened up about budget biases in Bollywood. Sushmita Sen and her ex, Rohman Shawl, were seen together, maintaining a friendly relationship. 'Saiyaara' made a smashing debut, becoming a top Hindi grosser of 2025.

title: Caitlin Clark roasts Kelsey Plum; fires back at All‚ÄëStar presser jab, WNBA fans go wild
content: Caitlin Clark and Kelsey Plum are embroiled in a playful yet pointed exchange after Plum's seemingly innocuous photo in front of a Nike logo. Clark sarcastically thanked Plum for the 'Nike Ad,' a jab following Plum's All-Star presser comment singling out 'Team Clark' for poor attendance at a pre-game meeting for demonstration against pay disparity.

title: Pakistan: Viral video shows 'honour killing' in Balochistan desert; 11 held
content: A disturbing video circulating online depicts the broad daylight murder of a couple in Balochistan, Pakistan, allegedly due to an "illicit" relationship. The footage shows the couple being led into a desert area by a group of men before being shot at close range, sparking widespread condemnation across the country.

title: Parliament ruckus: PM Modi holds key meet; Shah, Nadda attend
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi convened a significant high-level meeting in Parliament on Monday, with key BJP leaders in attendance. The discussions likely centered on strategizing and making crucial decisions concerning the ongoing Monsoon session, which commenced on the same day and is scheduled to continue until August 21. Modi hailed the session as a 'Vijay Utsav,' celebrating the armed forces' capabilities.

title: IND vs ENG | India could hand Test debut to Anshul Kamboj at Old Trafford
content: Team India might hand debut to fast bowler Anshul Kamboj in the crucial fourth Test against England at Old Trafford. Kamboj practiced under the watchful eyes of coach Gautam Gambhir and Morne Morkel during Monday's net session. With Arshdeep Singh injured and Akash Deep potentially unfit, Kamboj could fill the void in India's depleted pace attack for this must-win match.

title: 'We demand justice': India‚Äôs badminton stars cry foul; 6 players banned due to admin disaster
content: A major controversy has struck the Indian badminton squad at the World University Games in Germany, as administrative errors barred half the team from competing. Officials failed to properly register all twelve players, leading to accusations of career sabotage. Despite the setback, the six athletes who did compete secured a bronze medal.

title: New Income Tax Bill: Changes in TDS refund claims while filing ITR? Parl panel top points
content: A parliamentary committee reviewing the Income Tax Bill 2025 suggests allowing individual taxpayers to claim TDS refunds beyond the deadline without penalties. The committee also advocates for tax exemptions on anonymous contributions to trusts serving both religious and charitable purposes, addressing concerns about the taxation of NPO receipts and potential negative impacts on numerous organizations within India's NPO sector.

title: India head coach Gambhir: 'We want to build Man United's culture' - Watch
content: The Indian cricket team, led by Shubman Gill, visited Manchester United amidst their Test series against England. Gautam Gambhir engaged in insightful discussions with the Manchester United manager, Ruben Amorim, focusing on team culture and adaptability. Both Gambhir and Gill emphasized the similar mindsets required in cricket and football, highlighting the importance of players adapting to team needs.

title: Runway scare: 3 tyres burst after AI flight skids at Mumbai airport
content: On Monday morning, an Air India A320, flight AI-2744 from Kochi, experienced a runway excursion at Mumbai airport due to heavy rain. The aircraft veered off Runway 27 but managed to taxi to a parking bay after running into an unpaved area.

title: Flesh eating bacteria: How to know if a water body is infested
content: Flesh-eating bacteria, Vibrio vulnificus, thrives in warm, salty, or brackish waters, especially during summer and after storms. It enters through cuts and wounds, causing rapid infections. Coastal regions, particularly the Gulf Coast and Florida, are high-risk areas. Checking local health advisories and avoiding swimming with open wounds are crucial preventative measures.

title: Alan Poisner surprises world by winning gold at 90 with no coach and no support team
content: At 90, Dr. Alan Poisner continues to achieve racewalking success, securing a gold medal in the 3,000-meter walk at the World Masters Athletics Indoor Championships in 2025. Inspired by Olympian Debbi Lawrence, he has been competing for four decades and now walks about 28 miles a week to prepare for the National Senior Games.

title: Invoking criminal law for recovery of money is abuse of law: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the misuse of criminal law for civil disputes, particularly in money recovery cases. It expressed concern over High Courts ignoring previous rulings and emphasized that a breach of contract doesn't automatically constitute cheating unless fraudulent intent is proven from the start.

title: Paresh Rawal hits back at trolls for drinking his own urine: 'Are they feeling..
content: Paresh Rawal, fresh from resolving 'Hera Pheri 3' issues, faced internet backlash after revealing he drank his own urine to recover from an injury 40 years ago. He defended his actions, questioning why critics were bothered since he didn't offer them any. Rawal dismissed the controversy, stating people are making a big deal out of nothing.

title: Travis Kelce goes solo in LA as Taylor Swift faces family emergency
content: Pop singer Taylor Swift is helping her father, Scott Swift, recover after heart surgery. Her partner, Travis Kelce, was seen driving in Los Angeles. Kelce is supporting Swift and her family during this time. He is also preparing for Kansas City Chiefs training camp. Kelce and his brother are pausing their podcast.

title: Judge cash recovery row: Over 200 MPs seek removal of Justice Yashwant Varma
content: Over 200 MPs have initiated impeachment proceedings against Justice Yashwant Varma following the discovery of burnt cash at his residence in March. The motion, supported by members across party lines, cites constitutional articles and a report recommending his removal. The Supreme Court has declined to urgently hear a petition related to the case, as Justice Varma denies any wrongdoing.

title: 'Seeing investigation through facts': What aviation minister told Parl on AI crash
content: Civil Aviation minister K Rammohan Naidu assured the Rajya Sabha that the AAIB is diligently investigating the Air India crash, which claimed 260 lives, following a rule-based and unbiased process. The investigation aims to uncover the truth behind the incident, utilizing data from the black boxes decoded domestically for the first time.

title: Akash Deep undergoes fitness Test before 4th Test; Morkel closely monitors
content: Team India faces injury concerns as Nitish Kumar Reddy is ruled out, and Arshdeep Singh is sidelined for the fourth Test against England. Akash Deep, currently nursing a groin niggle, is undergoing a fitness assessment. His participation hinges on the assessment by bowling coach Morne Morkel and the team physio.

title: 'Let political battles be ...': SC rejects ED plea in MUDA case
content: The Supreme Court dismissed the Enforcement Directorate's plea against a Karnataka High Court order, which had quashed proceedings against B.M. Parvathi, wife of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, in a land allotment case. The court questioned the ED's involvement, suggesting political battles should be resolved by voters.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Bhaichung Bhutia slams ISL, calls for ‚Äòreset‚Äô in Indian football
content: In an exclusive interview with TimesofIndia.com, former India captain Bhaichung Bhutia slammed the ISL‚Äôs structure and called for a complete overhaul in Indian football. With stakeholders incurring losses, youth teams underperforming, and the country‚Äôs premier domestic league‚Äôs future in limbo, Bhutia has demanded urgent reforms to save the sport in India.

title: India may relax rules for Chinese investment in electronics; but only with ...
content: The Indian government is likely to support Chinese investments in the electronics sector through joint ventures with Indian companies, emphasizing technology transfer over mere assembly. This approach aims to bolster domestic manufacturing capabilities and value addition.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office collection day 4 (LIVE): Ahaan Panday film expected to remain steady on Mon after...
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara' has achieved a record-breaking opening weekend, surpassing Rs 90 crore in just three days. The film's success is attributed to positive word-of-mouth and its appeal to both youth in multiplexes and audiences in smaller centers.

title: 'Born again on 21st July': Parag welcomes new member; pic goes viral
content: Riyan Parag, the young Indian all-rounder, has adopted a critically injured stray dog named Janam, rescued by animal activist Manavi Rai. Parag is sponsoring Janam's extensive recovery, promising him love and care. He also acknowledged Virat Kohli as his inspiration, who presented him with his ODI cap, marking Parag as the first male cricketer from Assam to achieve this milestone.

title: 'Udaipur Files' row: Govt recommends 6 changes, stalls release till SC hearing
content: The Central government has suggested six modifications to the film 'Udaipur Files,' following a Delhi High Court directive. These include changes to an AI-generated execution scene, character references, and dialogues. The recommendations also involve revising the disclaimer, removing credit frames, and deleting references to a character named "Nutan Sharma" and related dialogues, along with certain dialogues about the Balochi community.

title: Unbelievable! 'Pitches were ... ': Harbhajan Singh's big jibe at Virat Kohli
content: A recent podcast featuring Harbhajan Singh and R Ashwin has seemingly resolved any perceived tension between the two legendary Indian off-spinners. Harbhajan clarified that he never felt jealous of Ashwin's success, even after Ashwin surpassed his wicket tally.

title: NEET UG 2025 counselling registration begins, check link and key dates here
content: NEET UG 2025 counselling registration starts now. Students can apply for MBBS and BDS seats. The Medical Counselling Committee manages the process on mcc.nic.in. Registration and choice-filling close on July 28, 2025. Around 1.3 lakh seats are available across India. Courses begin September 1, 2025. There are 775 participating institutes. Counselling includes three rounds and a stray vacancy round.

title: Which NFL teams have the best -- and worst -- rosters? Let's stack all 32 projected lineups
content: We ranked every NFL roster ahead of the season, then picked strengths, weaknesses, X factors and underrated players to know.

title: NFLPA's Tretter to resign amid union overhaul
content: NFLPA chief strategy officer JC Tretter is resigning from his position and has withdrawn himself from consideration for the interim executive director position.

title: Trump aims at stadium over Commanders' name
content: President Donald Trump is threatening to hold up a new stadium deal for Washington's NFL team if it does not restore its old name and is calling for Cleveland's baseball team to revert to its former name as well.

title: Titans' Levis to have surgery, miss 2025 season
content: Titans quarterback Will Levis has elected to undergo season-ending surgery on his right shoulder, meaning rookie Cam Ward will take first-team reps in training camp.

title: No drama: Scheffler adds The Open, 3rd Slam leg
content: Scottie Scheffler captured the third leg of the career Grand Slam, cruising to a four-stroke victory in the Open Championship for his fourth win in a major.

title: Knueppel-led Hornets win 1st summer league title
content: Kon Knueppel, the fourth pick in this year's NBA draft, scored 21 points, and Charlotte held off a Sacramento rally to beat the Kings 83-78 on Sunday for the Hornets' first summer league title.

title: Bradley says Bryson will make Ryder Cup team
content: Bryson DeChambeau will represent the United States at this year's Ryder Cup regardless of whether he secures an automatic qualifying spot for the event.

title: AAC launches rebrand as 'American Conference'
content: With the new mascot "Soar" the eagle, the 15-member AAC has officially rebranded as the "American Conference" and will introduce a modernized website on Thursday.

title: No. 1 running back Cooper commits to Longhorns
content: Texas continued its recruiting tear Sunday by securing the commitment of Derrek Cooper, the top-ranked running back in the 2026 class and the seventh-ranked prospect overall.

title: üíé Eagles' Super Bowl ring has pop-out wings
content: The Eagles' Super Bowl LIX rings feature a hidden button that, when pressed, extends the wings on either side, revealing coach Nick Sirianni's saying, "You can't be great without the greatness of others."

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: A new No. 1 and best landing spots
content: A red-hot slugger on the move? An All-Star outfielder available? Our running list of who could be traded by the deadline has new names at the top.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Scottie Scheffler's unique dominance over golf continues at Open Championship
content: Scheffler's march on Royal Portrush was a masterclass and proof that his approach is unlike anyone else's.

content: NBA expert Kevin Pelton looks back at 10 of the biggest trade and free agency moves and regrades them.

title: UFC 318 fight grades: Did Poirier vs. Holloway live up to the hype?
content: Max Holloway vs. Dustin Poirier capped Saturday's pay-per-view, but did that matchup top ESPN's UFC 318 fight grades?

title: MLS Power Rankings: Philadelphia jumps Miami into first place
content: El Trafico may have been the game of the weekend, but the Philadelphia Union are the team to beat according to ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: England's semifinal record is the result of hard work and unity
content: England are in their sixth major semifinal in 10 years, but it's no accident. The togetherness of the squad has made it happen.

title: Inside the Vikings' creative plan that saved J.J. McCarthy's lost rookie season
content: A knee injury kept the No. 10 pick off the field, but McCarthy spent the season preparing in unique ways to be the 2025 starter.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: From Kevin Durant's Team Durant to Carmelo Anthony's Team Melo, these next-gen AAU stars got next
content: NBA stars such as Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony sponsor their own high school AAU shoe-circuit teams.

title: A glimpse of what was to come: Stars who have showed out at Peach Jam
content: Before these stars went to college basketball and the NBA, they showed their stuff at the Nike Peach Jam.

title: Sources: Liverpool finalising $106m Ekitike deal
content: Liverpool are finalising a move for Hugo Ekitike after they agreed a deal worth up to ¬£79 million ($91m) with Eintracht Frankfurt, sources have told ESPN.

title: Source: D√≠az wants to leave Liverpool  for Bayern
content: Luis D√≠az remains determined to leave Liverpool this summer and hopes Bayern Munich will make a new offer to sign him, a source has told ESPN.

title: Arteta '100%' backs Arsenal's Partey protocols
content: Mikel Arteta has said he "100%" believes Arsenal followed the correct protocols regarding Thomas Partey's time at the club after the midfielder was charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

title: Rashford arrives in Barcelona ahead of loan move
content: Marcus Rashford landed in Barcelona on Sunday ahead of completing a season-long loan move from Manchester United.

title: Sources: Utd close on Mbeumo before U.S. tour
content: Man United are hopeful of completing the signing of Bryan Mbeumo in time to be part of their preseason tour of the U.S., sources have told ESPN.

title: Modric, Gimenez left out of Milan preseason tour
content: New signings Luka Modric and Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez will not be part of AC Milan's preseason tour across the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Messi scores 2, sets up 2 as Miami routs Red Bulls
content: Lionel Messi had two goals and two assists to lead Inter Miami CF to a bounce-back 5-1 win over the host New York Red Bulls on Saturday night in Harrison, New Jersey.

title: Source: USMNT's Sargent close to Wolfsburg move
content: USMNT forward Josh Sargent is on the verge of joining Bundesliga side Wolfsburg for a deal worth in excess of ‚Ç¨21 million, a source has told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United in for Chelsea's Jackson or Leipzig's Sesko
content: Manchester United are interested in taking striker Nicolas Jackson off Chelsea's hands. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Probe Agency Summons Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, 2 Others In Betting App Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned actors Rana Daggubati, Prakash Raj, Vijay Deverakonda and Lakshmi Manchu for questioning in a money laundering case linked to illegal online betting and gambling by certain platforms, official sources said on

title: After No-Show Today, Google, Meta Summoned Again By Probe Agency In Betting App Case
content: Tech giants Google and Meta have been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) yet again, directing their representatives to appear before it on July 28.

title: What Next in Impeachment Process For Judge Caught In Cash-At-Home Row
content: The process of impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma having started in parliament with a memorandum signed by 145 MPs, Speaker Om Birla is expected to carry the ball further tomorrow, by forming an inquiry committee.

title: 115 Land Plots, Assets Worth Crores: What Odisha Vigilance Found In Raid On Officer
content: An official in Odisha was found to have 115 land plots in his name, gold weighing 200 grams, a small armoury containing rifles, and other assets worth crores during a raid by the Vigilance Department on Sunday.

title: Assam's Bulldozer Action To Free Wetland From Encroachment In Guwahati
content: The Assam government on Monday carried out a massive bulldozer operation to clear a wetland of encroachment, involving the demolition of the International Institute of Hotel Management (IIHM) located in Guwahati's Cachar.

title: "Justice Must Prevail": Families Of Mumbai Blasts Victims Demand CBI Probe
content: Hours after the Bombay High Court acquitted all 12 men convicted in the 2006 Mumbai train blasts case, families of the victims on Monday voiced strong concerns and demanded a fresh investigation, urging the Centre to hand over the case to the Central

title: Ajit Pawar Party Leader Suraj Chavan Told To Resign Amid Marathwada Protests
content: Ajit Pawar, who heads the Nationalist Congress Party, has asked Suraj Chavan to resign immediately from the position of state president of the party, following his involvement in the assault on Chhava Sanghatana activists in Latur.

title: Excerpt | 'Jeetu Bhai, Many Have Been Killed': A Journalist Recounts 2006 Mumbai Train Blasts
content: "'Jeetu bhai!!! A bomb has exploded in a train outside my building!  Many people have been killed. Send a camera unit fast,' Odysteven Gomes from my channel screamed on the phone...I hastily left the cinema hall and rang the cops to get more details.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 6 Ways China Beat Trump At Trade Negotiations - And What India Can Learn
content: As the US presses India with a "take-it-or-leave-it" offer, New Delhi must draw critical lessons from how China successfully negotiated with Washington in June 2025.

title: Siren Ban Order Issued Across Karnataka During VIP Movement
content: In a significant move to enhance public safety and reduce noise pollution, Karnataka Director General of Police Dr. M.A. Saleem has issued a statewide order prohibiting the use of sirens during VIP movement.

title: "Ditch Instagram, Learn AI Or Get Left Behind," Says Perplexity AI CEO
content: Cut down the time you spend on social media and prioritise learning Artificial Intelligence (AI). This is the Perplexity AI CEO Aravind Srinivas' message to the youngsters.

title: Supreme Court Relief To Actor Shreyas Talpade In Multi-Crore Chit Fund Scam Case
content: The Supreme Court, in an interim order passed on Monday, granted protection from arrest to Bollywood actor Shreyas Talpade, following multiple FIRs filed against him in different states for allegedly duping people of crores through a chit fund scheme

title: 'Drishyam'-Style Murder Near Mumbai. Wife Hides Husband's Body Under Tiles
content: In a chilling case reminiscent of a scene from the Bollywood blockbuster 'Drishyam', a woman in Maharashtra's Palghar district reportedly murdered her husband with the help of her lover and buried his body inside their home.

title: EPFO Adds Over 20 Lakh Members In May, Highest Since Data Tracking Began
content: Year-on-year analysis revealed a 2.84 per cent growth in net payroll additions compared to May 2024, signifying increased employment opportunities and heightened awareness of employee benefits, bolstered by EPFO's effective outreach initiatives.

title: 16 Students, 2 Teachers, Pilot Killed As Jet Crashes Into College In Dhaka
content: A Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashed onto a school campus in Dhaka's northern Uttara area on Monday afternoon, killing at least 1 person and injuring others, according to the military and a fire official.

title: Video: Raging Flames, Panicked Students - Aftermath Of Dhaka Jet Crash
content: Panicked students, parents and teachers were seen running in confusion with a backdrop of screams, wails and raging orange flames.

title: "Cracking Under Pressure": Raghav Chadha Flags Aviation Safety, Minister Responds
content: AAP MP Raghav Chadha on Monday raised alarm over the state of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), alleging that the aviation regulator is "cracking under pressure" due to severe understaffing, underfunding, and lack of autonomy.

title: 13 School Children, Driver Injured In Van-Truck Crash In UP: Cops
content: Thirteen school children and a driver were injured on Monday when a school van had a head-on collision with a truck in the Saurikh area here, police said.

title: Jharkhand Woman Kills Husband With Hammer For Having Affair, Arrested: Cops
content: A 29-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly killing her husband for having an extramarital relationship with another woman in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharswan district, a police officer said on Monday.

title: Supreme Court Extends Stay On 'Udaipur Files' Release Until Thursday
content: The Supreme Court on Monday ruled that the stay on the release of the movie Udaipur Files will remain in effect until Thursday.

title: ICAR-CIBA successfully sequences genome of goldlined seabream
content: Being a euryhaline species, the fish has strong potential for farming across a wide range of salinities and various production systems, including ponds and cages

content: LDF convener T.P. Ramakrishnan recalls how VS led countless struggles and intervened in people‚Äôs issues. Brinda Karat calls VS a warrior for the poor and history-maker

content: Congress MLA has said that it will come under CM‚Äôs Special Infrastructure Development Scheme as budgetary provision has been made for it

title: Malampuzha, the ‚Äòriver‚Äô that saved V.S. Achuthanandan
content: He was re-elected from the Malampuzha Assembly constituency four times in a row.  The constituency helped him cement his iconic status in Kerala politics by backing him consistently from 2001 until his retirement from active politics

title: Sanjay Kaul takes charge as head of GIFT City
content: Mr. Kaul, an IAS officer and also a native of Gujarat, brings over two decades of experience in public policy, infrastructure development, technology, and finance; he succeeds retired IAS officer Tapan Ray, who served as MD and Group CEO since 2019

title: India ready to extend all possible support: PM on Bangladesh plane crash
content: India stands in solidarity with Bangladesh and is ready to extend all possible support and assistance, PM said.

content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu highlights investment potential in the Rayalaseema region, stresses the need to create a robust manufacturing ecosystem that can cater to global demand

content: The fish canteens developed under Sanjeevini National Rural Livelihood Mission are aimed at empowering women economically

content: Many students are allegedly trying to get NRI-ward seats illegally and by submitting false documents

title: Quarters for MLAs, officials in Amaravati to be ready by December: Narayana
content: Remaining capital city buildings targeted for completion by March 2026, says the Minister adding that 72 companies have already been allotted land in the capital region

title: Ultrasonic laser spine surgery study from Guntur wins Asia-Pacific Award
content: The study by Mallika Spine Centre, Guntur, explores the integration of ultrasonic laser technology in endoscopic spine surgeries for back and neck pain

title: Commuters blame lack of enforcement as accidents rise on Kozhikode-Kuttiady stretch
content: Despite a rising number of fatal accidents and public complaints, the route lacks proper speed detection cameras and enforcement measures.

title: Kharge will have a chance to become potential PM candidate, says Rayaraddi
content: He takes exception to BJP leaders, including B.Y. Vijayendra and Chalavadi Narayanaswamy, making ‚Äòsarcastic comments‚Äô against the AICC president

title: Naidu, Jagan mourn death of veteran Communist leader V.S. Achuthanandan¬†¬†
content: They recall the former Kerala Chief Minister‚Äôs decades-long commitment to public service, social justice, and people‚Äôs movements

title: Index of eight core industries grows at three-month high of 1.7% in June
content: The data, released by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry on Monday, July 21, showed that the coal sector saw the largest contraction while the steel and cement sectors saw the strongest growth.

title: Institute of Cardiology at RGGGH: Caring for hearts for half a century
content: Handling a high volume of patients with various cardiac conditions every day, the institute, inaugurated in 1972, has evolved significantly over the decades.

title: Country boat fishermen in Pazhayar struggle for space amidst harbour development
content: Fishermen allege since the commencement of Pazhayar Fishing Harbour work under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana, their traditional boat parking zones have been encroached upon by larger mechanised trawlers

title: Catholic community charts political comeback in central Travancore
content: All Kerala Catholic Congress comes up with an action plan aimed at fielding maximum number of community members in the forthcoming local body elections.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Will consult Centre on restarting London flight service stopped after Ahmedabad plane crash: Goa CM
content: Mr. Sawant was speaking in the assembly after BJP MLA Michael Lobo sought to know when the Air India flight service between Gatwick and Goa will resume.

title: CIBA scientists sequence genome of Matti Vaayan fish
content: The species is considered a promising candidate for expanding India‚Äôs aquaculture sector, a CIBA press release said

title: Mortal remains of former Kerala Chief Minister V.S. Achuthanandan will be kept at old AKG Centre on Monday evening
content: On Tuesday, Achuthanandan‚Äôs body will lie in State at Durbar Hall at Secretariat.¬†His cortege will proceed to Alappuzha on Tuesday afternoon. Funeral will be held with full State and party honours at the Valiyachudukadu cemetery on Wednesday

title: Eco-tourism infrastructure gets a boost with two eco huts getting ready in Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Pachamalai hills
content: Two eco huts and the renovated British-era bungalow at Top Sengattupatti to be thrown open to visitors soon, amenities for visitors improved at Koraiyar and Mangalam waterfalls

title: Labourer dies while cleaning manhole in Bengaluru‚Äôs RMC yard
content: The owner of the house engaged the duo offering daily wage and did not provided any safety gear, the police said.

title: Karnataka police chief restricts use of siren by VIP escort vehicles
content: In a reminder issued on July 21, M.A. Saleem, Director General and Inspector General of Police of Karnataka, said that the decision has been taken considering public safety and noise pollution

title: Supplyco to make market intervention to rein in prices during Onam season: Minister G.R. Anil
content: Minister chairs meeting at Supplyco headquarters in Kochi. Efficient interventions are being made to ensure availability of all essential items at low prices during Onam season, he says

title: Telangana CM wants ATC courses to match emerging requirements of industry
content: Mr. Revanth Reddy directs officials to set up a model ATC in Genome Valley. Officials informed 111 centres are proposed to be developed, 49 functional so far

title: V.S. Achuthanandan: a mass leader moulded by Alappuzha
content: For VS, Alappuzha was not merely his birthplace, but the crucible of resistance from where he rose ‚Äî as a labourer, trade unionist, revolutionary, freedom fighter, and politician.  It shaped him into one of the preeminent communist leaders and laid the foundation for his emergence as a values-based mass political leader in Kerala

title: Nandyal Member of Parliament seeks night landing facility at Orvakal airport
content: Nandyal MP Byreddy Shabari  met the Civil Aviation Minister in Delhi and submitted a representation seeking more flights from the Orvakal airport

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu unveils Green Hydrogen Valley declaration
content: The ambitious declaration outlines a comprehensive roadmap for building India‚Äôs largest ecosystem for green hydrogen production, research, and application; the policy aims to make Andhra Pradesh a pivotal hub in India‚Äôs green economy transition

title: Rajya Sabha passes The Bills of Lading, 2025
content: Rajya Sabha passes Bills of Lading, 2025, to update the shipping document legal framework, addressing concerns about e-bill of lading

title: V.S. Achuthanandan: Comprehensive coverage on former Kerala CM‚Äôs life and times
content: A compilation of stories on the communist stalwart in Kerala who passed away at the age of 101. V.S. Achuthanandan rose above the cut and thrust of provincial politics

title: V.S. Achuthanandan: there is no replacement for VS in Kerala politics
content: VS was an Opposition Leader who rushed to wherever the poor faced difficulties in social life and in all these, he led the party to generate social momentum and movements. At the same time, he raised all those issues like in a battleground in the Assembly

title: V.S. Achuthanandan, an unlikely green warrior
content: VS, the then¬†78-year-old Leader of the Opposition, undertook a physically demanding trek to  Mathikettan Shola, a verdant forestland rich in rare flora and fauna quietly being devoured by encroachers. His journey, a symbolic yet resolute act, catalysed in the government declaring it a national park

title: In memoriam: Former Kerala CM and veteran Communist leader V. S. Achuthanandan ‚Äî 1923-2025
content: Images from the life and times of veteran CPI(M) leader and former Kerala Chief Minister V.S. Achuthanandan, 101, who passed away

title: V.S. Achuthanandan, not just a leader but a legacy
content: We stood on opposite ends of the political spectrum. Our debates were spirited, sometimes fierce. Yet there was always mutual respect, says Ramesh Chennithala

title: V.S. Achuthanandan combined class politics with mass politics
content: The CPI(M) leader prompted a course correction in the party leadership by bringing people‚Äôs issues to public sphere

title: Kerala government‚Äôs OTT platform ‚ÄòCSpace‚Äô yet to go the next level
content: Platform is aimed at ensuring space as well as revenue share for low-budget, independent films. Lack of popular commercial films, however, has been an impediment to CSpace‚Äôs growth

title: AI is improving efficiency in governance, with grievances addressed 25% faster, says IT Secretary
content: AI can help in credit scoring and loan disbursement, S. Krishnan said, with data flows from GST and other sources ascertaining creditworthiness

title: V.S. Achuthanandan, a leader who never forgot his roots
content: The veteran leader shared a deep bond with his native place. He always stood with the poor and downtrodden. He was ready to listen to their problems and help resolve them

title: Government agrees to 16-hour discussion on Operation Sindoor, Pahalgam terror attack in Lok Sabha next week
content: Opposition members protested that the government's agenda for this week did not mention their demand for a debate on the issue.

title: 'Yemen's fate same as Iran': Israel strikes Hodeidah port; warns Houthi rebels
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world . read More 10 things to know before getting a pet Indian Ringneck Parrot Raashi Khanna‚Äôs skincare routine Saree tales by actress Anumol Minimal mehendi designs for Teej 2025 9 herbal teas that are good for health

title: Why Drake Maye can be a top-10 QB in 2025
content: in 11 starts from Week 6 to Week 17, Drake Maye threw for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns and 10 interceptions . that translated to an average of 16.0 fantasy points per game in those starts, which would have ranked just outside the top 12 quarterbacks over a full season . Maye has all the makings of a top-10 fantasy quarterback .

title: Premier League's big spenders gear up for epic title race
content: the premier league title race has turned into a spending spree that could top ¬£1 billion before a ball has even been kicked in the 2025-26 season . the clubs who claimed the top four positions last season will attempt to wrestle the crown from champions Liverpool . but the teams attempting to bridge the gap risk falling even further behind .

title: Euro 2025 semifinals: How do you tactically beat each team?
content: the quarterfinals produced very exciting matchups at the 2025 edition of the women's Euros . the 2022 finalists, Germany and England , needed penalties to progress to the last four . but who will emerge victorious and make it to the final? Here are the strengths and weaknesses of the teams .

title: From Aaron Rodgers to the tush push, let's catch up on an active offseason
content: it's technically the offseason, but there has been plenty of action around the league in the five months since confetti rained down on the Philadelphia Eagles in new Orleans . there's going to be a lot of mail rerouted to and from Pittsburgh after this offseason . general manager Omar Khan spent the last couple of months wheeling and dealing .

title: WNBA All-Star grades: MVP Collier scores A+ in leading team to victory
content: team collier beats team Clark 151-131 at Gainbridge Fieldhouse . team captain caitlin Clark was sidelined by injury . the city of Indianapolis embraced hosting the game, and fans showed out in full force .

title: What's next for Max Holloway and Paulo Costa after UFC 318?
content: max Holloway wins by unanimous decision over Dustin Poirier . the title has been successfully defended for the first time . there is one currently sitting outside the lightweight title picture who should be next . click here for all the latest boxing news .
